content: Los Angeles' Metro Rail opens the Regional Connector project to the general public.
Miami mayor Francis Suarez launches his presidential campaign.
In ice hockey, the Vegas Golden Knights win the 2023 Stanley Cup Finals for their first Stanley Cup in franchise history. Jonathan Marchessault wins the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoffs MVP.
A mass shooting in Denver injures 10 people celebrating the Nuggets championship.
In basketball, the Denver Nuggets win the 2023 NBA Finals, their first NBA championship, in five games against the Miami Heat. Nikola Jokic wins NBA Finals MVP.

Dick Clark Productions and Eldridge Industries acquire all rights and assets relating to the Golden Globe Awards. As a result, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association and its membership will be shuttered at a later date.
The FTC files to block the proposed acquisition of Activision Blizzard by Microsoft.

Trump reveals on Truth Social that he has been indicted by Jack Smith's special counsel over mishandling of classified documents found at the FBI search of Mar-a-Lago. He pleas not guilty before court the following Tuesday.
The Supreme Court rules that Alabama must redraw its congressional map as it violates the Voting Rights Act of 1965 in racially discriminating against African Americans in the state.
CNN CEO Chris Licht departs the network after a 15,000 word profile disgracing Licht was published in The Atlantic.
